description: Feels too soft and rather one-dimensional, although the flavors are very good. The best thing about the wine, aside from dryness, is the richness of tannins. The fruit veers toward blackberry marmalade and currants. Doesn't seem like an ager, so drink up.
title: Tercero 2007 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is an informal and fresh Cabernet that would pair perfectly with easy pasta dishes or lasagna. Aromas include black cherry and plum and the wine offers a polished and compact feel overall.
title: Tommasi 2008 Poggio al Tufo  (Maremma)

description: A delicate but complex nose of peony, bergamot, Anjou pear and hard melon transition to a somewhat surprisingly lean mouth flooded with citrus flavors. The nuances of the bouquet are mostly missing on the palate, but this remains a clean and refreshing white.
title: Les Deux Rives 2009 Blanc White (Corbières)

description: Gets the job done with its rich tannins, crisp acids and solid blackberry, mocha and orange zest flavors. Easy to drink, and ready now. Production was 1,685 cases.
title: Morgan 2008 Syrah (Monterey)

description: A bit unusual and confusing, but that's because it hails from the Rioja region. The nose is herbal and mustardy, with green aromas leading to a cidery palate of apples and spice. There's also a bit of lemon and creaminess to this cava. Hard to understand but not without its merits.
title: Muga NV Casa Conde de Haro Sparkling (Cava)

description: Delicious fresh citrus flavored wine, bright as a button, lively and crisp. Made from Alvarinho, there is a creamy texture with a mineral element, finishing with green plums and banana flavors.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Quinta dos Loridos Branco Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: With a light, silky texture, this Pinot glides over the palate, carrying rich fruit and spice flavors. They include raspberries, pomegranates, cola, red licorice, cinnamon and pepper. It's lovely in many respects, but it's also notably sharp in acidity, a problem that's unlikely to go away.
title: Casa Torres 2006 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Lots of tropical fruit, orange, lime, pear and buttered popcorn flavors in this Chardonnay. It's very bright in acidity, and is almost honey-sweet on the finish.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2009 Stainless Unoaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A wine that suffers from high toast and not enough fruit weight. In time, it should settle down, but it is always going to be a wine that is on the lean side.
title: Château de Bel-Air 2007  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Pure black berry juice, ripe and solid, this is a chunky, fresh wine. The wood edge is a major factor; there is a final stalky, mineral element. Drink now.
title: Château du Cèdre 2008 Chatons du Cèdre Malbec (Cahors)

description: The balance between the firm tannins and ripe fruit works well here. The texture is dense, rough at the edges but with good layers of wood, acidity and dry tannins. The aftertaste has welcome freshness.
title: Château du Port 2007 Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

description: After the scent of char blows off a bit, this first harvest Merlot opens sweetly to aromas of vanilla, cinnamon spice and plush, red plums. There's a hint of green stalks and leaves detectable on the palate amidst underripe black cherry and plum flavors, but bright acidity gives this wine a fresh character and the spiced plum finish is pleasant.
title: Comtesse Thérèse 2005 First Harvest Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: The nose offers plenty of cooked plum preserves, warm spice and toasted, nutty oak. There's a nice, lush texture and body, and bright red cherry and plums flavors on the palate. The fruit flavors may be slightly lacking in concentration, but supple tannins make for smooth, easy sipping.
title: Comtesse Thérèse 2006 Aquebogue Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Tastes its best now, with jammy blackberry, cherry and raspberry flavors, and a rich overlay of oak. The tannins and acids are soft and gentle.
title: Ty Caton 2008 Caton Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: There's a maturity that shines through from the honeyed applesauce and steel aromas in this off-dry Riesling. Rich and full bodied on the palate, bright, fresh apple and lemon flavors linger elegantly on the tongue with a hint of bitter lime pith.
title: Wagner 2008 Select Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Co-released with the 2007 Zin-Petite Sirah blend, this wine shows the same characteristics. It's dryish, tannic and rustic, with peppery flavors framing berries, currants and smoked meat. Give it a good decant before serving.
title: Watkins Family 2008 Zinfandel- Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)

description: Sweetly ripe and oaky, with pineapple jam, kiwi, pear and green apple, and notes of vanilla, buttered popcorn and cream. Defines the fruit-forward, buttery style of Chardonnay in a soft, forward way.
title: Paradise Ridge 2008 Sapphire Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Opens somewhat clipped and choppy, with citrusy aromas mixed with red fruits. The palate is healthy, lean and acidic, with bright plum and berry flavors softened by some creamy vanilla. A solid wine with punch, acidity and a good finish.
title: Ramón Bilbao 2005 Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Nice and dry, with good varietal flavors of blackberries and currants, wrapped into rich tannins. It's a fine Cabernet to drink with ordinary food, and a good value.
title: Salvatore Principe 2007 Running with the Bulls Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: Nemus pairs the light fruit and crisp acidity of Sangiovese against the hearty firmness of Cabernet Sauvignon to produce an informal, food-friendly wine that would match pasta dishes and pizza with fresh mozzarella.
title: Scopetani 2007 Nemus Red (Toscana)

description: Spy Valley's 2007 Envoy Pinot Noir is an attractive wine, featuring an exterior of brown sugar, dry leaves and coffee and a fruit-filled cherry center. The only concern is the slightly drying finish and some slightly coarse, rustic tannins. If those resolve gracefully, this rating may look stingy in 3 years' time.
title: Spy Valley 2007 Envoy Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Mostly Sangiovese with smaller percentages of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this informal wine offers freshness and simplicity. You'll recognize balanced aromas of red fruit, spice, leather and a touch of chewy pipe tobacco.
title: Ciacci Piccolomini d'Aragona 2007 Red (Toscana)

description: Layers of char, black pepper and briar patch help to build complexity in this dense, concentrated black plum Merlot. There's a touch of green leaf and tomato throughout, but overall, it's a fruit-driven, luscious wine accented with spice and smooth, supple tannins. Aged 24 months in new French oak.
title: Comtesse Thérèse 2004 Château Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: As sharp, fresh and fruity as a jar of raspberry, cherry and blackberry jam, melted into liquid and fortified with alcohol. Feels hot, too, despite an official alcohol reading of just 14%. The winery held this back for five years, an expensive investment in storage, but the wine just can't quite overcome its limitations.
title: EOS 2005 Cupa Grandis Grand Barrel Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: Here's an easy Sangiovese-based wine (with a small percent of Petit Verdot for extra darkness and color) that would pair wonderfully with stay-home pizza or pasta. The wine offers bright berry nuances of cherry and raspberry and a touch of distant spice and smoke on the fade.
title: Fattoria Scopone 2006 Il Gregoriano Red (Sant'Antimo)

description: Sweet and a little grassy on the nose, with lemon-lime aromas. The palate has a solid, regular, friendly feel along with sweet flavors of white nectarine, apple juice and tarragon. Perfectly quaffable, dry in feel despite being semisweet, and balanced. For the price, what's not to like? Imported
title: Freixenet NV Carta Nevada Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Clean and approachable, with lemon-lime aromas leading to an easy, mildly crisp palate with lemon, lime and honeydew flavors. Sweet in accordance with standard extra dry guidelines, and also good for apéritifs and sparkling cocktails.
title: Freixenet NV Cordon Negro Extra Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: Light and only gently structured, this is a cru wine that is more about juicy red fruits. It has attractive acidity and a touch of spice. It is likely to be ready to drink in the next few months, certainly by mid-2017.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Léon  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This is a ripe, soft and rich cru wine. With its attractive cherries and gentle tannic structure, it is fruity and easy. The acidity that comes through at the end gives the wine a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 Pisse Vieille  (Brouilly)

description: This wine is 60% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 5% Mourvèdre. Vanilla aromas are prominent along with prune and other dried fruit. Fruit and barrel flavors intermingle on the palate, with the fruit seeming dried out.
title: Keira 2014 G-S-M (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An intriguing, distinctive nose combines hickory smoke, baked raspberry and a touch of sage. Dark-red cherry and cranberry meet with thyme on the sip, where swirling flavors strive to find a centerline.
title: Layer Cake 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Barrel aromas are out front with notes of wood spice, vanilla and cocoa followed by dark cherries and herb, starting to show a bit of age. The palate is fruit filled but shows the restraint of the vintage. The oak seems a bit overweighted.
title: Liberty Lake 2011 Merlot (Red Mountain)

description: This variety is an extreme rarity in this appellation. This one offers aromas of wet penny, spice and red fruit. The palate is medium bodied, with the tannins bringing some grit.
title: Liberty Lake 2012 Tempranillo (Red Mountain)

description: This is a dark, intensely astringent wine with so much grape and oak tannin that it's challenging to enjoy now. Since PV is known as a grape that provides color and tannin in Bordeaux wines, it's no wonder that it's so stiff today. It will drink best after 2020.
title: Parducci 2013 Reserve Petit Verdot (Mendocino)

description: Made entirely with Trebbiano and vinified in oak, this opens with aromas of mature orchard fruit, citrus, chopped herb and a whiff of toast. The linear, rather lean palate offers toasted almond, coffee, oak and green pear.
title: Pieve de' Pitti 2013 Tribiana Trebbiano (Toscana)

description: Made with Sangiovese, Ciliegiolo, Foglia Tonda and Pugnitello, this offers delicate aromas of black cherry and cinnamon. The aromas cross over to the easygoing palate together with a hint of thyme and smooth, pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Podere Il Castellaccio 2014 Valente Red (Toscana)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, the shy nose eventually reveals red berry and a hint of thyme. The straightforward easygoing palate delivers red cherry and clove alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Podere Il Castellaccio 2015 Dinostro Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: This softly layered wine has a tannic bite that undergirds its lighter stylistic approach. Currant, cedar and vanilla play on the palate in pleasant, straightforward ways.
title: Franciscan 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This grand estate was once a hunting ground for an even grander nearby chateau. The cru wine that's now produced here is crisp and fruity, streaked through with acidity and red currants. It has a touch of tannin as well as minerality. Drink from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château de Nervers  (Brouilly)

description: This is a family-owned estate whose wines is made by Georges Duboeuf. It is structured and firmly concentrated, more tannin than fruit. That gives the wine a lean character that seems to miss out on fleshy and fruit. Give it a little time and drink from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Clos des Quatres Vents  (Fleurie)

description: Blackberry and boysenberry flavors so ripe they seem sweet fill out this smooth, full-bodied wine. The texture is soft and not at all tannic, letting the potent fruit flavors flow easily through the finish.
title: Great American Wine Company 2013 Zinfandel (California)

description: Waxy citrus skins and pressed apple notes are accented by a whiff of pine in this racy light-footed Riesling. It's just a shade off dry, with an invigoratingly brisk texture. Drink now through 2019.
title: 240 Days 2015 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Aromas of red fruit and herb are followed by light but pure cherry flavors. It provides a lot of easy-drinking appeal.
title: Boomtown 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A mix of unidentified red varieties, this wine opens slowly, without much in the way of aromatics. Weedy sage, tobacco and a grip of tannin give it weight and richness alongside its full body, as a bramble of blackberry and currant weave within.
title: Buena Vista 2014 The Count Founder's Red (Sonoma County)

description: Cutting lemon, lime and tangerine flavors lend puckering refreshment to this light-bodied dry Riesling. It's lean in style but invigorating and fresh. A hint of zest adds bite to a lingering finish. Drink now through 2020.
title: Sheldrake Point 2015 Dry Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: You'll find aromas of wild berry, violet and a touch of leather in this wine. Straightforward by Brunello standards, the medium-bodied no-frills palate offers dried cherry and dark baking spice alongside solid tannins. It has a rather abrupt finish. Drink through 2020.
title: Sommavite 2010  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Intensely fruity, almost tropical, on the nose, this juicy Chardonnay is chock full of fresh pineapple, melon and mango flavors. While not complex, it's a fun, widely appealing wine marked by bright acidity and luscious mouthfeel. Enjoy now through 2019.
title: Stony Lonesome 2015 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: A blend of 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Syrah, 17% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this has aromas of French oak and black-skinned fruit. The dense palate delivers plum, toast and a hint of chocolate alongside rather abrasive tannins.
title: Tenuta Cappellina 2013 Dianne Red (Toscana)

description: Made with 85% Sangiovese, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this shows subdued aromas of dark berry and cooking spice. The straightforward palate doles out crushed plum and clove alongside assertive tannins.
title: Tenuta di Ceppaiano 2015 Alle Viole Red (Toscana)

description: This blend of Sangiovese and 10% Merlot opens with delicate aromas of violet, berry and baking spices. The palate delivers black cherry, toast and clove alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
title: Tenuta Sette Ponti 2014 Crognolo Red (Toscana)

description: Sugary peach and a taste of stone surround a lifted, floral undercurrent in this wine that takes on a richer, creamier midpalate and hearty oak as it finishes.
title: The Federalist 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: While ripe nectarine and grapefruit notes are bold on the nose, the palate of this medium-bodied Gewürztraminer is a bit demure. It's a refreshing easy-drinking white, however, offering delicate hints of lychee, citrus and guava flavor. Drink now through 2019.
title: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2015 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

description: Citrusy aromas include pithy notes and a metallic hint of tin. This is more chunky in feel than tight, with moderate snap and acidity. Flavors of citrus fruits and green herbs end with mild acidity.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2016 La Joya Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: This 100% varietal wine offers a simplicity of blueberry, black licorice and chocolate wrapped in integrated tannin and oak. Full bodied and ripe, it softens in the glass to a rounded finish.
title: William Harrison 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Rutherford)

description: This varietal Sauvignon Gris isn't as aromatic as the more pungent Sauvignon Blanc. In the mouth, this is medium in body, with good overall texture. Dry racy flavors of scallion and bitter melon are not exuberant but turn fruitier on the finish.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2015 Isidora Sauvignon Gris (Maule Valley)

description: Aromas of fragrant blue flower and wild berry waft out of the glass. The easygoing no-frills palate offers juicy wild cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside supple tannins. It's enjoyable but already accessible and extremely straightforward by Brunello standards. Drink through 2019.
title: Bonacchi 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Woodland berry, blue flower, dried mint and a whiff of sunbaked soil take center stage on this easy-drinking red. The straightforward palate offers ripe red cherry and ground pepper alongside round, supple tannins.
title: Castellani 2015 Guadalmare  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: The Chermette family has produced a rich generous cru wine. It is structured and dense with some firm tannins from maturing in wood. It also has a generous black plum and cherry fruits that are developing well. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2015 Les Garants  (Fleurie)

description: The merest touch of passion fruit enriches the ripe pear fruit apparent on the nose with a hint of the tropics. The palate is wonderfully zesty and the gorgeous grapefruit freshness harnesses all the ripe fruit into a driven force of joy. This is concentrated, juicy and utterly moreish.
title: Proidl 2015 Ehrenfels Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: Dark gold in color, this appellation wine is tropical and salty, medium bodied with a strong taste of lemon preserves. Its fuller, richer nature is complemented by fresher streaks of grapefruit and mandarin, with a mineral component of wet stone.
title: Ram's Gate 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Golden Delicious apple, stone fruit and honey star in this vineyard-designate, a showcase for baked apple seasoned in nutmeg. Gravelly texture supports full-bodied flavor and a strength of toasted oak lightly suggestive in vanilla.
title: Ram's Gate 2014 Green Acres Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A whiff of passion fruit on the nose immediately hints at ripeness. The palate fulfils that promise not only with generosity but counters it with gorgeous grapefruit freshness and a lovely zesty texture that makes this very appetizing. The flavors are zingy, clean, ripe and very, very long. It is the grapefruit spice that gets you in the end.
title: Salomon-Undhof 2015 Lindberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: Though this is their appellation blend, Mikey Giugni and Michael Brughelli don't hold back, offering elegant aromas of rose petals, purple flowers, rich pomegranate fruit, rusty strawberries and light vanilla on the nose. The palate begins with a light cranberry-raspberry flavor that deepens into tart mulberry before showing dried rose petals, uncrushed clove and a lava-rock minerality.
title: Scar of the Sea 2014 Seven Leagues Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Light, bright and citrusy, this lovely wine is integrated in terms of oak and ripeness, letting its crispness of lemon and tangerine speak loudest. A complex, structured wine, it becomes more interesting as it opens, allowing room for specks of stone and nutmeg to peek through.
title: Small Vines 2014 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Produced from old vines in the Côte du Py on the slopes of an extinct volcano, this cru wine is structured with generous black fruits and a series of ripe tannins and balanced acidity. It has the structure and density to age while also having a light touch of black cherry fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Stéphane Aviron 2015 Côte du Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: The nose merely reveals the slightest shimmer of ripe lemon zest. The palate comes in with beautifully spicy mirabelle flavors, tempered by tangy citrus. There is lovely citrus concentration that has a zesty textural element in the streamlined body. This is wonderfully bracing, ripe and refreshing. A total joy.
title: Stift Göttweig 2015 Silberbichl Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

description: Warm tones of marzipan, roasted almond, yellow peach, pineapple and a touch of coconut are reminiscent of a piña colada on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard just behind the coastal town of Cambria. Gala apples and poached pears show on the sip along with lemon curd, chalk and meringue flavors, all tightly woven into a fresh expression of the grape.
title: Stolo 2014 Estate Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Bright and ready-to-burst flavors of raspberry and just-ripe cranberry show on the nose of this bottling that also features tartness and graphite minerality alongside vanilla and baking spice. More of an underripe character shows on the forest-floor palate, where thyme and marjoram mix with tangy red fruit, pine needle and juniper.
title: Wolff 2013 Dijon Clones Selection Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Although he is based in the Terres Dorées (golden earth) region of southern Beaujolais, this producer has an enviable palate of vineyards in the crus to the north. This wine comes from one. It has structure, density and a a solid core of both tannins and rich fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 Terres Dorées Grille-Midi  (Fleurie)

description: A very slight citrus lift, edged with ripe pineapple, on the nose announces a precise palate of lusciously ripe flavors: sun-ripened yellow mirabelle plums nestle alongside ripe oranges and clementimes. A straight, linear but ripe acidity at the very core keeps all of this fruit in check and provides direction and precision. Delicious and long.
title: Jurtschitsch 2015 Heiligenstein Reserve Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Deep aromas of hibiscus, rose buds, dark red berries and sugar plums are spiced up by cola, crushed pencils and lots of garrigue on this bottling. The palate is clean and crisp, with snappy raspberry, light cranberry and lots more chaparral-like herbs, including wild thyme, bay laurel, lavender and fennel pollen.
title: Kynsi 2013 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Gorgeously lifted rich notes of orange zest fill the nose of this beautiful “orange” wine. Fermented on skins, it has all the elegance of white wine, combined with the tannic structure and backbone of red. Made from pink Pinot Gris grapes, this lends itself beautifully to this treatment and leaves us with an intriguing, concentrated, fresh and whistle-clean wine of great expression. Savor its salty orange-scented length.
title: Meinklang 2015 Graupert Natural Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

description: Plump tangerine, pink grapefruit and warmer tones of Gala apples show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard that's slightly northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills appellation. Rounder nectarine and apple flavors show on the sip that fattens up in the midpalate with poached Asian pear and popcorn, deftly leveled throughout with a zesty lemon-wedge touch.
title: Parker 2014 Duvarita Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Decadent yet finessed, this intensely ripe, concentrated wine brims with fleshy flavors of black plum and cassis. Tart cranberry acidity and complexities of olive, savory spice and granite push the palate into greater depths. The finish is long, marked by fine firm tannins. It's lovely already, but should meld beautifully from 2020–2030 and further.
title: Paumanok 2013 Assemblage Red (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Rich notes of yeast on the nose promise a rounded wine, while on the palate they become even more pronounced and deliver a big hit of lasting umami flavors. Here and there white pepper pokes through with its freshness supported by leavening citrus notes. This is powerful stuff: Handle with care and pair with food that is both subtle and robust—just like the wine.
title: Ebner-Ebenauer 2015 Bürsting Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with aromas mature black-skinned fruit, French oak, exotic spice and a whiff of blue flower. The vibrant palate is both elegant and structured, delivering juicy black cherry, pomegranate, mocha, licorice and a potpourri of cooking spice. It's well balanced, with bright acidity and fine-grained tannins. It already dazzles, but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2018–2028.
title: Fontodi 2013 Flaccianello della Pieve Sangiovese (Colli della Toscana Centrale)

description: Violets, bacon fat and caramel sauce are drizzled across blueberry and olallieberry fruits on the nose of this bottling from Billy Wathen and Dick Dore. The palate is expertly integrated and deep with flavors of blackberry, pepper dust, tart black-plum skins, cocoa powder and roasted pork. It conveys classic Syrah flavors, done with grace.
title: Foxen 2014 Tinaquaic Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Dark boysenberry, dried lilac and the slightest touch of tar show on the nose of this bottling, one of the first that Foxen has labeled with the new Los Olivos District appellation. Tart plum skins and elderberry show on the sip that is structured by solidly dry tannins accented by flavors of lavender and thyme.
title: Foxen 2014 Williamson-Dore Vineyard Syrah

description: This small-production, single-vineyard white hails from a site at the southern end of the appellation, close to Carneros. It shines in golden apple, honey graham cracker and a rich texture that impresses from start to finish. A floral element persists and intrigues, a mix of wildflower and fennel.
title: Grow Wines 2014 Ruhl Vineyard Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Made with Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and a drop of Petit Verdot, this polished linear red has aromas of black-skinned fruit, bell pepper, coconut and toasted oak. The vibrant, elegantly structured palate offers black currant, chopped herb, clove and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Guado al Tasso 2013  Bolgheri Superiore

description: The nose just gives a gentle hint of ripe apricot. The palate, on the other hand, speaks freely of zesty citrus: ripe lemon and fresh Seville orange, full of tart zestiness and refreshing zing. This is slender and linear, taut but chock-full of fruit. There is drive and energy and total refreshment.
title: Hirsch 2015 Gaisberg Reserve Riesling (Kamptal)

description: There is something that makes me think about a summer forest: Is it the fresh moss, the fresh green foliage, the implied ease and freshness of light green foliage on a warm day? The palate stuns with white pepper and purity and combines fruit ripeness with ballerina-like poise. Wonderful texture. Prepare to be moved.
title: Ingrid Groiss 2015 Pankraz Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Meant to showcase the producer's classic style, this is made from 74% Pinot Noir and 26% Chardonnay, the lots chosen for their fruit forwardness. Succulent peach speaks quietly around bright floral aromas, while a richer undertone of hazelnut biscotti comes into play on the smooth palate.
title: Iron Horse 2011 Classic Vintage Brut Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: This new project from the heights of Atlas Peak involves Steve Matthiasson as both viticulturist and winemaker, having had to take over the reins from the late Denis Malbec. It shines in bristling acidity, dusty tannin and a beautiful floral aroma of violet. Notes of chocolate, fig and cigar sit atop a pillowy, complex structure, while vanilla lingers on the finish.
title: Acumen 2013 Mountainside Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Great fruit concentration and depth give power to this full-bodied wine from Cakebread, better known for its Napa-grown Cabernet Sauvignon and Chardonnay. Not tricked up with too much oak, it tastes energized, deep and layered. Black cherry, rhubarb and cedar fan out across the palate, lingering a long time on the finish. Best from 2018.
title: Cakebread 2014 Two Creeks Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Dense, baked and mulled blackberry and cassis aromas include bold but classy oak notes. This feels seamless except for raring tough tannins, while flavors of toast, graphite and spiced blackberry finish smooth and chewy, with a sense of lushness despite lasting residual tannins. Drink through 2025.
title: Cono Sur 2013 20 Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This bottling of the classic Italian variety hits the right notes, with cherry, rose and tar on the nose, along with hints of sandalwood and incense. It's smooth on the palate, with dried cherry flavor and touches of chocolate, dried mint and caramel on the finish. It's still young and the firm tannins ensure a long life. Drink 2018–2029.
title: Soulmate 2009 Estate Nebbiolo (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: There's a fun, spicy layer in the foreground of this wine that helps shape a modern, luscious and intense Chianti Classico with noticeable sophistication and dimension. It offers a lot of consistency and flavor and carries those elements forward over its long finish. Only 250 cases were made.
title: Montecalvi 2006  Chianti Classico

description: There's a lot of good about this small-production blend. The nose and color are nice, with asphalt and charcoal mixing with black-fruit sweetness. The palate has a nice, healthy texture housing slightly herbal plum and berry flavors. Finishing notes of burnt toast, coconut and mint announce a serious barrel regimen. Drink now–2009.
title: Odfjell 2005 Aliara Red (Central Valley)

description: Very dark in color, this is an impressive wine with power and dense tannins. The fruit is solid, packed with blackberry and dark plum flavors, and wild, almost savage, ripeness.
title: Calços do Tanha 2005 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Fresh, despite the dense tannin, this is a ripe, juicy wine, full of black currant flavors and vibrant acidity. Wood treatment shows more cassis just at the end to round the wine out.
title: Cálem 2006 Curva Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The minerality that seems to come from this quinta makes for a wine that needs time, and this wine is defiantly young. However, its chocolate flavors, bitter toast and dense structure all promise well.
title: CARM 2006 Quinta do Coa Red (Douro)

description: This Riserva takes on an elegant, harmonious personality and boasts delicate notes of berry fruit and vanilla in the background. It's not particularly thick or extracted, nor is it meant to be. Instead, it is elegant and easy on the senses and offers tight, chewy tannins.
title: Castello d'Albola 2004 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Rounded, and rich, this is touched with spicy wood and has plenty of black berry fruits. A solid structure, some fruit tannin and plenty of red-plum-skin edge finishes ripe.
title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2006 Cuvée Prestige  (Juliénas)

description: Very tight now, with minerally, yeasty flavors of lees and unintegrated smoky new oak. High acidity adds to the impression of austerity. Difficult to appreciate in its infancy, but this elegant, layered, complex Chard should begin to blossom after 2008 and hold for several years.
title: Pessagno 2006 Lucia Highlands Vineyard Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This doesn't have the sheer breadth of many Australian Viogniers, but it offers more structure and length on the palate. Vibrant lemon-lime and pineapple aromas set the stage for flavors of tropical fruit and lemon custard. There's a slightly creamy texture and a lingering finish. Imported by Tom Eddy Wines.
title: The Lane 2006 Estate Grown Viognier (Adelaide Hills)

description: A great value in Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, Hunter's 2007 marries ripe nectarine aromas and flavors with just enough acidity and a touch of grassiness to retain focus and varietal character. The lack of overt herbal notes makes it easy to pair with food, or drink on its own.
title: Hunter's 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Dark amber in color, this sophisticated vin santo offers aromas of resin, pine nut, caramel candy, molasses, chestnuts, honey and dried apricots. It has some spicy tones in the mouth, buffered around its sweet core, and long nutty flavors on the finish.
title: I Veroni 1999  Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina

description: Nearly a Best Buy, this Riesling offers early drinkability relative to many of its Clare cousins. Mixed citrus and crushed-stone aromas mark the nose, while the medium-bodied palate finishes long, with what seems to be a touch of sweetness. Drink now–2010.
title: Long Flat 2006 Destinations Riesling (Clare Valley)

description: Dark cola, black fruit and marzipan aromas give this a sweet bouquet. The palate is solid, with medium-strength tannins supporting cherry, blackberry and mocha flavors. Oak is no stranger to this wine, so expect ample vanilla and chocolate throughout. A bit herbal, which is common for Chilean Cabernet.
title: Odfjell 2005 Orzada Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: On the side, with a hint of warmth on the finish, this is nevertheless a very good wine. The aromas are powerfully mineral, accented by bold lime notes, while the flavors are intense and concentrated. Drink now.
title: Wakefield 2006 Riesling (Clare Valley)

description: This is a very good wine, albeit with some coarseness to the tannins at this time. It's also a little earthy and mushroomy. But there's a solid core of black cherry, red currant, mocha and tangerine zest flavors. The vineyard is near Sanford & Benedict, whose Pinots require time to come around. This young wine should do interesting things.
title: Alma Rosa 2006 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A layered nose with aromas of grapefruit, lemon and flowers is the start of this poised and pretty white. Crisp acidity, great balance and fresh, approachable fruit come together to offer an elegant, reliable sip. Pair with spicy foods, grilled fish or salads.
title: Bellingham 2007 The Steppe Buzzard Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

description: Asian spice and vanilla are the most immediate aromas but just past them are plum, prune and fresh blackberry. The wine has grit and sophistication and a smooth, velvety feel in the mouth that helps elevate the overall experience.
title: Castello Vicchiomaggio 2004 Riserva La Prima  (Chianti Classico)

description: Made from old vines and aged in wood, this is a rich, dense, now mature wine. The bright red fruit is softened by the wood, rounded out, then balanced with tannins.
title: Domaine Cheysson 2005 Cuvée Prestige  (Chiroubles)

description: Very dry and elegantly silky, this Pinot, from one of the best vineyards in the valley, brims with cherry, red currant, cola, licorice and peppery spice flavors. Seems at its best now and in the short term.
title: MacPhail 2006 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: From a reliable Clare Valley producer, Pikes 2006 Dry Riesling appears to be an ageworthy effort, boasting plenty of crisp intensity. Lime, grapefruit and green apple notes are classic Riesling markers, ending long and mouthwatering. Drink now–2016, possibly beyond. Imported by USA Wine West.
title: Pikes 2006 Dry Riesling (Clare Valley)

description: A soft, elegant nose evokes darker berries and spice on this subtle Pinotage. On the palate, pronounced spice and smoke is softened by luscious fruit and smooth tannins. A very pretty wine and an accessible version of a tough variety.
title: Robertson Winery 2006 Phanto Ridge Limited Release Pinotage (Robertson)

description: The dryness and minerality of this wine, combined with its clean, brisk elegance, make it a very nice partner for shellfish. The flavors are lemons, limes, and ripe, crisp white peaches.
title: St. Francis 2006 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: There's a subtle candy-like element to this wine's pretty nose that recalls vanilla and cherries sprinkled with dried flowers and green herbs. The wine has a lean, compact feel in the mouth and refreshes the palate thanks to its blueberry flavors and crisp close.
title: Tenuta di Lilliano 2005 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Almond, toast, vanilla bean and other oak-related aromas drive the nose of this vibrant Riserva from one of the most beautiful estates in Radda-in-Chianti. The wine has good harmony in the mouth where the natural fruit shines through and is powered by the wine's smooth structure and polished tannins.
title: Terrabianca 2005 Riserva Croce  (Chianti Classico)

description: This is a big, broad-shouldered Sauvignon Blanc, slightly oily in texture, with pungent scents of crushed tomato leaf and plenty of gooseberry fruit. The high alcohol, moderate acidity and richly concentrated fruit give the impression of sweetness on the long finish.
title: Villa Maria 2007 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Wairau Valley)

description: Backsberg's wines have style, and this Chenin is another in a line of successes. An assertive nose of pear, apple, honey and flowers leads a wine offering lovely citrus and floral flavors, cut slightly with a dancing acidity. The wine has dimension but a fresh edge.
title: Backsberg 2007 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: More oak and color than the regular Calina Merlot, but that means more coconut, resin and char as well. Black raspberry and currant-like flavors are plump and medium-long, while the finish has some tannic grab and girth along with woody touches like vanilla and spice. With 20% Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Calina 2006 Alcance Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Good structured fruit, with ripe sweet cherry flavors, appears alongside hints of raspberries. Fresh, but with some weight and solidity.
title: Château du Châtelard 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Gently wood aged, the wine is rich in tannins and with generous red fruits. It is ripe with pepper as well as red-fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Opta 2016 Red (Dão)

description: This is a soft wine with open fruits and gentle tannins. A blend of local varieties along with Syrah, the wine is smoothly textured, generous and ready to drink.
title: Perescuma 2016 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: This new range of wines from Lagoalva features typical Portuguese tiles (azulejos) on the label. Inside the bottle, this wine is fruity with soft tannins, spice and red-berry flavors. It has a juicy aftertaste that blends with the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Lagoalva Vinho Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Aromas suggesting nail polish remover, stewed plum, cellar floor and oak lead the nose. The evolved palate reflects the scorching vintage, offering raisin, powdered sage and balsamic notes alongside bracing grainy tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink sooner rather than later.
title: Signae 2011  Montefalco Sagrantino

description: This is a full-bodied big-shouldered wine blended with Malbec and Syrah, that's inky and dark. Grippy tenacious oak surrounds a mouthful of black olive, black plum and tobacco.
title: Thorn 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Cherry and black olive aromas are common for standard Chilean Cabernet, which this is. A fleshy, flush mouthfeel is raw due to prodding acidity and tannins. Herbal berry flavors are spicy and a touch green, while this tastes minty on the finish.
title: Viña Maipo 2015 Vitral Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Chile)

description: This youthful crisp blend of Chardonnay and Fernão Pires comes from the Lisboa region. With a light texture, plenty of acidity and a fruity aftertaste, it is a great apéritif style.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Bruto Sparkling (Lisboa)

description: This is a simple, acid-driven white that's light and bright with a restrained sense of ripeness. Tight-grained oak is wrapped around a buttery middle.
title: Auburn 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tarry berry aromas come with notes of olive, rubber and eucalyptus. A tight, racy palate is driven by acidity, while this tastes of herbal plum and lightly salted tomato sauce. Woody, herbal berry flavors are spicy and a bit green.
title: Balduzzi 2015 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: This wine opens with a perfumed nose of lavender and geranium. Wafts of blueberry, raspberry and red plum abound and carry through to the palate, which is also quite floral. Nicely balanced, easy to enjoy, the finish is smooth and flavorful but doesn't last long.
title: Bogati 2016 B Malbec (Virginia)

description: The spicy aroma and burnt toast character of this young wine reflects its strong wood aging. The black fruit is right behind though, likely to break through the dry surface over the next few months. Drink from 2019.
title: Château du Luc 2016  Côtes de Bourg

description: This ripe but balanced wine has ripe wood aromas and a solid tannic structure. Its black currant fruitiness is still developing, promising future juiciness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Cormier 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Produced from organic grapes, this lightly structured wine is full of black currant fruitiness. With a touch of spice from wood aging, it's soft and easy to drink now.
title: Château la Guillaumette 2015  Bordeaux

description: This wine ultrarich—perhaps too much so. With intense apricot and spice flavors, it's a dense powerhouse of bitter botrytis that lacks elegance. Although it will soften with time, the superripe character will remain.
title: Château les Roques 2013

description: This second wine of this estate is aged in tank, making it all bright, ripe berry fruit and juicy acidity. The tannins are still there as it's still aging. Give this attractive, fruity wine until late 2018 before opening.
title: Château Roc de Boissac 2014 La Millerie  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

description: This wine has a strong herbal component of bay laurel and eucalyptus, girded in fully realized tannin and a juicy underbelly of cherry cola.
title: David Bruce 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Blended with 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, wood aromas are at the fore, with notes of baking spice followed by braised green pepper along with jalapeño pepper and blackberry. The flavors are saturated and ripe, bringing a sense of softness that provides intrigue.
title: DiStefano 2013 Carmenère (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Related to Syrah, Mondeuse is one of the main red grapes in the Savoie region. This light, fruity wine is typical of the style, with its tight acidity, attractive red fruit and touch of pepper at the end. Ready to drink.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2016 Mondeuse (Savoie)

description: One of a pair of single variety rosés from Eric Poli, this is crisp, with an earthy edge typical of this grape. Its red currant fruit and acidity offer a delicious, refreshing contrast. Drink now.
title: Domaine Poli 2016 Sciaccarellu Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine is soft, with raspberry flavors and acidity in equal abundance. It's light in color, tastes mature and should be drunk now.
title: Domaine Torraccia 2013 Red (Corse Porto Vecchio)

description: This is a blend of 45% Syrah, 33% Grenache and 22% Mourvèdre. Strong aromas of eucalyptus leaves dominate a thick tannic concentration of dark cherry and cassis with a light simplicity to the finish.
title: Enkidu 2015 Cuvée JM Red (Sonoma County)

description: This soft ripe wine is smooth and velvet textured. Its black fruits and ripe tannins are well integrated with the acidity and juicy aftertaste. The blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira, Petit Verdot and Alicante Bouschet is eclectic but certainly works. Ready to drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Away from its native vineyard in the north of Portugal, the Alvarinho becomes extra rich and ripe in the hot center. That's the case here with a soft wine that has apple and pear flavors. It is light on the acidity, always fruity and easy to drink with food. Drink now.
title: Herdade das Servas 2016 Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: Alvarinho from the northern Vinho Verde region lends itself to bubbles with its naturally crisp character. It gives a wine that has a tight mineral texture that lifts the citrus and green-apple fruits. The wine, packed with acidity, is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Reserva Bruto Natural Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This rich blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is all fruit without any oak aging. That gives the wine a ripe black-fruit character, balanced with acidity and a light touch of spice. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Red (Alentejano)

description: The volatiles are amped up here, providing some aromatic distraction. The palate brings high-octane fruit flavors, supported by lightly dry tannins. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
title: Luke 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

description: Sour cherry, apple and a hint of baking-spice aromas carry over to the easygoing palate along with a confectionery note. It's bright and simple, with fresh acidity.
title: Massimo Ronca 2016  Bardolino Chiaretto

description: This dry rosé is made, as are most of the wines from this producer, from Merlot. It gives a soft, smooth and lightly caramel flavored wine though with plenty of acidity to keep it crisp. Drink this wine now.
title: Nelson Neves 2016 Neves Colheita Merlot Rosé (Bairrada)

description: Vanilla and cinnamon notes show some oak influence in this medium-bodied well-made wine that has enough plum and red-cherry flavors to balance out a lightly tannic texture.
title: Plungerhead 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: This wine is in the “velvet” school of red blends, showing a very supple, rich texture and a definite level of sweetness to soften the overall impact. It has sweet-seeming aromas like maple syrup and blackberry jam, and ripe fruits on the palate too.
title: Prophecy 2015 Red (America)

description: A rich, full-bodied while also crisp wine. It has some bottle age giving an edge of toastiness to this blend of four grapes, Pinot Noir, Gamay, Chardonnay and Aligoté. There is a good orange zest tang, a steely edge and tight final acidity.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Réserve Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This delivers dense and chewy flavors of spirit-soaked raspberry, nutmeg and chocolate-covered orange. Its velvety smoothness is energized by fresh acidity, making this very easy to enjoy. Pair it with mushroom risotto or semi-seasoned cheeses.
title: Fabiano 2010  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso

description: Here's a delicious and bright wine that boasts plum, black cherry, white pepper and nutmeg sensations. It combines the freshness of Valpolicella with the ripeness of Amarone, and is very food friendly.
title: Farina 2011 Montecorna  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso)

description: Ripe black cherry, raspberry and wild strawberry notes abound on the nose and in the mouth of this accessible wine. Medium weight, with fine yet spicy tannins and a medium-length finish that's kissed with a hint of mocha. Easy, approachable and food friendly; drink now.
title: Les Vignerons de Tautavel Vingrau 2009 Réserve Vieilles Vignes Red (Côtes du Roussillon Villages Tautavel)

description: A complex, full-bodied wine that is full of mature fruit flavors with a touch of toast to add to the attractive mix. With apple, quince and almonds well blended together, this is a finely balanced wine, that could age for a couple of years more.
title: Louis Bouillot 2007 Perle d'Or Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Medium-intense scents of ripe blackberry and raspberry unfold on the nose of this wine, with additional accents of garrigue and softly toasted oak in the background. Dark fruit flavors abound on the palate, with a solid sweet-spice flavor that stays through the lasting finish.
title: Domaine du Clos des Fées 2009 Vieilles Vignes Red (Côtes du Roussillon Villages)

description: Briny, slightly herbal aromas suggest lifted horse hide and leather notes. This is lively on the palate, with herbal, foxy flavors of plum and cassis that finish with toasty oak, licorice and heat. This is a bright, honest introduction to what Priorat wines are about.
title: Finca Tobella 2009 Negre Red (Priorat)

description: This wine, solid and dense, is full of firm tannins as well as red cherry fruits. It's also fruity, with a great juicy character that permeates right through the wine. For drinking now, but better kept for 2–3 years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine de Lavernée  (Chiroubles)

description: Delicious and soft in raspberries, cherries and the sweet vanilla and the cinnamon toast of new oak, this is a charming Pinot to drink now. It's light and airy in the mouth. Perfect with a simply prepared grilled steak or lamb chop.
title: Walt 2011 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Full, rounded and rich, this wine shows some wood flavors as well as complex tannins and acidity. There's a funky edge to it that suggests a rustic character. At the end, though, the acidity of the vintage dominates.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a straightforward Amarone, with red fruit and spice aromas. The palate delivers cherry and raspberry flavors and a hint of white pepper. It's not as rich as some Amarones, but the lithe tannins and fresh acidity make it very drinkable.
title: Recchia 2006 Ca' Bertoldi  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: The Kingpin Cabernet leans into the flavors of savory herb and leaf, with peppery accents to the light strawberry fruit. It's a pleasant, relatively light style that fades into a gentle finish.
title: Sparkman 2010 Kingpin Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: This blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, sends up toasty aromatics richly imbued with the scents of new oak. John Bookwalter consistently makes wines in this style, which in a cooler year such as 2010, can seem to mask the fruit. Give it plenty of breathing time and the blackberry and black cherry core will begin to emerge from the toast, mocha and coffee.
title: J. Bookwalter 2010 Foreshadow Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Medium sweet in style, this is as much about ripe tropical and pineapple fruits as about spice and richness. It's an opulent, full-bodied wine, showing its spice right up front. At the same time, it is well balanced, hinting at acidity at the end. Drink from 2015.
title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2011 Vieilles Vignes Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: While there is an initial barnyard edge, once that blows off, it reveals a dense and solid wine, packed with ripe black fruit and sweet tannins. The acidity brings out spice and edgy, mineral characters.
title: Kopke 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This leads with pretty fragrances of plum and black cherry, with hints of oak and vanilla. The palate is soft and round, offering dark fruit and chocolate flavors layered with cinnamon and nutmeg.
title: La Dama 2010  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso

description: A first for Lauren Ashton, this barrel-fermented Sémillon was sourced from the excellent Dineen Vineyard. It's firm and tightly packed with melon, jicama, pineapple and green banana fruit. Highlights of honeysuckle and lemon verbena are also in the mix. The finish is a little short, but more bottle age might well bump up the score.
title: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2012 Sémillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: If fruit were the only thing that counted, this Pinot would get a perfect score, with an upfront burst of cherries, strawberries and raspberries. The oak appliqué is rich and balanced, and the tannin-acid structure is just fine. Its powerful fruit notes suggest to give it 6–7 years.
title: Mansfield-Dunne 2011 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made from Chardonnay and Pinot Gris, this bubbly is light in body and elegant, with a cloud-like lightness. The palate is high toned with flavors of oranges, limes, honey and vanilla bean. The bubbles are scoury. Drink up.
title: Mumm Napa 2008 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This has a fragrance of black fruit, vanilla and oak. On the palate, it shows mature blackberry and plum-cake flavors, along with very evident oak and toasted notes. While this is still alluring, the fruit and freshness are starting to fade, so drink soon.
title: Musella 2008 Riserva Fondatori  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Complex in Middle Eastern and baking spices, Occasio's Petite Sirah is meant to be a tribute to the Livermore Valley's early days of viticultural promise and it delivers in a modern way. With a juicy mouthfeel of red and black fruit, it retains vibrant acidity and finishes long.
title: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

description: Gold in color, this is a mature wine interesting for its roasted almond and spice flavors, very ripe and rich. Drink this full-bodied wine now.
title: Leon Beyer 2007 Cuvée des Comtes d'Eguisheim Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: The richness of the vintage is very apparent in this full-bodied wine. With weight, structure and dark black fruits, it is textured and showing some vanilla and spice. Smooth, developing well and ready to drink in 2014.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Red (Buzet)

description: Lots of rich, savory Pinot flavors in this silky wine. It's kind of generic, and not showing much sense of terroir, but it is a properly grown coastal wine whose brisk acidity highlights cola, pomegranate and persimmon flavors. Drink up.
title: MacMurray Ranch 2011 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made with the Friulano grape—formerly known as Tocai Friulano—this white offers lemon peel and mineral aromas that carry over to the palate. It's long and linear, with a crisp finish.
title: Mario Schiopetto 2011 Friulano (Collio)

description: This is a solid Cabernet that shows the promise of the appellation in the central part of Monterey's Salinas Valley. It's dry and medium-bodied, with savory red-cherry candy, cranberry and currant flavors.
title: Muirwood 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Arroyo Seco)

description: An unusual blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Pinot Grigio and Pinot Meunier, this bubbly is, in a word, delicious. It's ripe with oranges, pineapples, honey and vanilla, with crisp acidity and a Champagne-like sourdough leesiness.
title: Mumm Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Decadent in coffee, toffee and caramel tones, the leathery mouthfeel of this wine is met head-to-head by a juiciness of ripe, dense blackberry fruit. An approachable Petite Sirah that will also please lovers of the variety's chewiness and concentration.
title: Nine North Wine Company 2010 Seven Sinners Petite Sirah (Lodi)

description: This savory selection offers a spicy bouquet of black pepper, nutmeg and clove, along with blackberry and cherry notes. It has a refined and vibrant palate, with black cherry, pepper and spice notes framed by silky tannins and refreshing acidity.
title: Novaia 2010 Vigneto I Cantoni  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore)

description: The American oak aging (80%) plays a significant role here but not in a bad way. There are notes of toast and Mounds bar with ripe flavors and a cranberry-filled finish.
title: Roza Ridge 2010 Syrah (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: All varietal, the aromas juxtapose notes of dark plum and chocolate with generous wood spices. The wood and fruit seem to tussle on the palate, with the wood winning out on the finish.
title: Tenor 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromas offer light notes of vanilla, plum and clove. The palate is full and generously flavored, with the tannins bringing some grit.
title: Three Rivers 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fresh boysenberry aromas and Concord grape scents are lifted by cracked peppercorn on the nose of this bottling. There is a touch of dill to the palate, where black cherry and chocolate flavors also arise on the lighter, simple yet tasty bottling.
title: Graveyard 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: The nose on this bottling shows fresh boysenberry and primary grape scents, with lots of sweet rosemary and purple flower nuance. The sip is not overly complicated, with tar at first and then waves of blackberry and boysenberry fruit, lifted by thyme and peppercorns.
title: Graveyard 2014 Graveyard Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Very ripe and sumptuous notes of blueberry pie make for an appetizing proposition. This blueberry fruit plays the major role on this medium-bodied but fresh, easy-drinking red. It is full of joy and provides a dense, balance palate of ripeness and ease.
title: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)

description: Aromas of Band-Aid, herb, cranberry and cherry lead to elegantly styled fruit flavors. Chewy tannins and tart acids provide the frame.
title: Hedges 2013 La Haute Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: This 100% varietal wine is made in a seemingly light-handed style, lean on the palate in graphite and tart cherry, with a diluted edge. It gains succulence in the glass, with a juicy overlay of tobacco and cinnamon-dusted raspberry.
title: Hensteeth 2010 Verlander Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: The wine is ripe and soft, with a style that is more towards tropical fruits. So apricots, ripe pears are cut with crisp acidity. The wine is tangy at the end with orange zest flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2015 La Reine Blanche  (Sancerre)

description: A red-fruit-dominated rosé that is full of bright fruits and a smooth texture. It has acidity to balance the ripe nature of the wine. This style is really for food, ripe and rich in the mouth.
title: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2015 Les Villots Rosé (Sancerre)

description: The aromas of gooseberry, lime, herb and passion fruit pop. The flavors are broad and tart. The concentration isn't quite all there but it brings plenty to hold the interest and should do well at the dinner table.
title: Kerloo 2015 Boushey Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

description: The personal project of longtime Souverain winemaker Ed Killian, this is a rich, round and full-bodied white, offering sizable components of baked pear and apple, the oak toasty and integrated.
title: Killian 2014 Adam and Eve Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tart red cherry notes beckon on the nsoe and lead to a light, slender, translucent body of unpretentious fruit and freshness. This is the sort of easy-drinking, dry wines you absolutely must have in your picnic basket: uncomplicated fruit, freshness and joy.
title: Kohl 2014 Classic Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)

description: This is a brooding, medium-bodied wine made by a Cabernet Sauvignon producer. Strawberry, cassis and a sprinkling of mountain pine play on the palate with enough body and weight to pair well with food.
title: Kristodd 2015 Rosé (Howell Mountain)

description: Fresh, pliable, slightly pear and apple scented and dry—what's not to like? This does not make any demands on you and is a marvel of versatility, also implying lots of fun and freshness. Easy-drinking, dry Grüner with a wonderfully appley finish.
title: Laurenz V. 2015 Singing Laurenz V. und Sophie Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This is a bit more confected and immediately approachable than some of the cave cooperative's other cuvées, but it remains a well made, very drinkable rosé. Scents of bubble gum and crushed multivitamin kick things off, followed by flavors of mixed berries and citrus, finishing on a zesty lime note. Drink now.
title: Les Vignerons de Tavel 2015 Le Chant du Soleil  (Tavel)

description: Aromas of pure lemon zest and green pear notes fuse into lime zest on the streamlined palate of this easy and superrefreshing summer Riesling. Drink soon.
title: Loimer 2015 Lenz Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: Pressed black plum and crushed dill team up for a lively and fresh nose on this bottling that also offers tobacco and coffee aromas. Woody cedar flavors lead the palate that is full of lighter-toned strawberry and red-plum fruit. Black pepper adds spice and pencil lead adds minerality.
title: Lorenzi Estate 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

description: Intensely ripe red apple and cherry flavors abound in this fun, slightly funky sparkling wine. Fermented in the bottle but undisgorged, its delicate froth fills the mouth with a fine, soft fizz and a slightly leesy finish.
title: Macari 2013 Horses Sparkling Cabernet Franc Rosé Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Rich black cherry, cola, turned earth and smoked meats show strongly in the inviting nose of this bottling from the San Luis Obispo County appellation's namesake winery. A fine-grained tannic structure kicks off the palate, where smoked blueberry and elderberry meet with leather flavors, all carrying a decent weight for such an affordable wine.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2014 Merlot (Central Coast)

description: Toast, espresso, oak and grilled sage aromas lead the way while the firm palate delivers ripe raspberry, fleshy cherry, powdered sage and star anise. Astringent tannins provide support but also dry out the finish.
title: Enzo Boglietti 2012 Case Nere  (Barolo)

description: Lifted lemony flavors signal a fresh wine. The palate, in contrast, has more rounded, fluid notes and a core of freshness with a distinct hint of alcoholic heat on the finish.
title: Graf Hardegg 2015 Vom Schloss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This is the winery's inaugural vintage of this wine, which blends Birch Creek Grenache (57%) and Mourvèdre (14%) with estate Syrah. The aromas pop, with notes of stargazer lilies, dried tobacco, white pepper and red fruit that lead to soft, silky, very pretty fruit flavors.
title: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Red Wine G-S-M (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This blend of 59% Roussanne, 36% Grenache Blanc and 5% Viognier is very lemony on the nicely restrained nose that also offers mango, yellow apple and grapefruit pith. Once sipped, the wine is wide and welcoming with red and yellow apples, Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors, proving quite easy-drinking.
title: Zaca Mesa 2013 Z Blanc White (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Chunky stone-fruit aromas are ripe, mature and indicative that this Chardonnay is about to start fading. Heavy, honeyed flavors of nectarine and apple finish with a note of oxidation, mild barrel spice and just enough acidity to maintain balance. Drink now.
title: Torres 2012 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)

description: Ripe, saturated berry aromas are toasty and oaky, with a note of licorice. This tannic, bold Mencía lives on the dark side. Flavors of black fruits are spicy, while on the finish this is tarry and charred, with chunky weight.
title: Vega Montán 2012 Adriá Mencía (Bierzo)

description: Jammy blueberry aromas are grapy, with ample char and grit coming from background oak. This feels firm, wiry, grabby and drying. Jammy, herbal flavors of cassis and blueberry finish with big, rubbery, elastic tannins.
title: Vinos de Arganza 2012 Legado de Farro Roble Mencía (Bierzo)

description: The aromas bring appeal, with notes of sour cherry, herbs and spice. The palate is light bodied, tart and elegant, with a coffee-filled finish. It's a pretty expression of the variety.
title: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fruity, floral and honeylike flavors give a lot of oomph to this wonderfully expressive, medium-bodied wine. It's as if honeysuckle and orange blossoms were soaked in fresh pear juice.
title: Graziano 2014 Dry Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County)

description: Generously filling and satisfying, this Bordeaux-styled blend is mostly Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. It's medium in oak and tannin, with a toasty character underlying red cherry, currant and cassis, the ending marked by cedar and clove.
title: Hensteeth 2009 Proprietary Red (Sonoma County)

description: The nose on this semi-dry Riesling is a touch savory, brimming with green herb, pressed apple and pear aromas. The palate, however, turns fresher, floral and fruity, filling the mouth with sweet-tart grapefruit and peach flavors. Nervy acidity extends a moderately long finish.
title: Heron Hill 2014 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Smokey, volcanic notes of slate, ash and charcoal are followed by blackberry, plum and prune. You'll also get resin, tar, asphalt and tobacco lavished over the wine's thick consistency and drying tannins.
title: Cantina del Taburno 2004 Delius  (Aglianico del Taburno)

description: Caparzo's lush and full 75-25 blend of Chardonnay and Traminer is faithfully representative of a white wine from Tuscany. You'll get aromas of peach and passion fruits backed by warm tones of vanilla and mature melon.
title: Caparzo 2005 Le Grance White (Sant'Antimo)

description: A little bulky and maybe just beginning to fade. This is a rounder and chunkier specimen than the 2008 Cipreses SB, and it shows softness at its core and hints of green bean and bell pepper. Fortunately, holdover acids and green-fruit notes bring it back to higher ground. Drink immediatelyor wait for the release of the '08 vintage.
title: Casa Marin 2007 Laurel Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

description: Made by the same team as Château Pichon Lalande, this is a tensely textured, austere wine, still young when tasted, but showing good potential to develop into elegance, with black fruit and dense tannins blending easily into fresh acidity. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Château Bernadotte 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: A finely structured and shaped wine, the Sauvignon Blanc dominating the blend, but offering more of its tropical fruit side than its herbaceous character. However, there is a good hint of balanced wood, lifting and giving extra richness.
title: Château Brown 2006  Pessac-Léognan

description: A perfumed, new wood-dominated wine, but one that does have the weight of fruit to support the wood. The tannins edge between fruit and wood, layered over rich black plums and bitter chocolate flavors. Under everything is fresh acidity to give the wine a welcome, vivid final lift.
title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: In the northern Margaux village of Soussans, Deyrem-Valentin produces a delicate wine, with simply structured blackberry jelly flavors, just edged with dark tannins. The flavors are sweet, ripe, open, not for aging.
title: Château Deyrem Valentin 2006  Margaux

description: Structured and austere, this is firm, dark and dry. The black currant fruit flavors are edgy, with juiciness only coming through right at the end.
title: Château la Cabanne 2006  Pomerol

description: Chocolate and bitter cherries dominate this full-on wine, packed with spice and toasty wood flavors. In mouthfeel, it is very rich, smooth, dense and velvety at the same time.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2006 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Velvety textured and full in weight with moderate tannic presence, this wine is powerful while remaining immediately approachable. Black cherry, blueberry, menthol and iris aromas lead into the palate of stewed red berries, pepper and eucalyptus leaves. A lingering finish of muted thin mint closes beautifully.
title: Château Les Palais 2004 Cuvée Tradition Red (Corbières)

description: Immediately attractive, even if not showing much density, this wine floats by on fresh red currant and berry fruits, soft tannins and a mouthwatering, juicy close.
title: Château Marquis de Terme 2006  Margaux

description: In recent years, the Gardiniers of Phélan-Ségur seem to have become preoccupied with wood, generally too much. It's the same in 2006, and it is a shame, because everything else about this wine is balanced—the fruit is ripe and sweet and there is some freshness from a cranberry note. It just needs the wood to become less dominant.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2006  Saint-Estèphe

description: Spicy, slightly resinous with notes of leaf, clove and licorice that complement good dark cassis fruit. Some coffee and smoke enter into the middle and finish, though the flavors fall away rather quickly. It's well balanced and a pleasure to drink, but not built for cellaring.
title: Adamant Cellars 2006 Red Blend Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This mature red wine from the Castel del Monte area of Southern Italy is made with 100% Uve di Troia and delivers thick layers of cherry fruit, chocolate fudge and exotic spice (it sees 14 months of oak aging). Its color is rich and saturated and the wine has a polished but ripe finish.
title: Agrinatura 2005 Giancarlo Ceci Parco Marano Uva di Troia (Castel del Monte)

description: Softly tannic and direct in jammy blackberry, cherry and red plum flavors, with chocolate overtones that have a candied, sugary edge. Not showing a great deal of complexity now, but could evolve in a few years. Hard to predict.
title: Alma Rosa 2007 La Encantada Vineyard - Clone 777 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Spicy, earthy, assertive…this wine has character. Toast, fruit, minerality and citrus on the palate gives it a fun feel, but the wine is seriously good. Excellent for seafood or more complex Asian cuisine.
title: Rustenberg 2006 Five Soldiers Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: Here's a Riserva interpretation of Uva di Troia with a solid base of berry fruit backed by more sophisticated aromas of toasted oak and spice. The wine is firm and solid in the mouth with long, wood-driven tannins.
title: Santa Lucia 2004 Riserva Le More Uva di Troia (Castel del Monte)

description: Ripassá is a wine that has been refermented on the skins to produce extra richness and intensity of aromas. This distinctive wine offers tones of blackberry jam, currant, clove and curry powder. It's a luscious and slightly sweet tasting wine with chewy tannins.
title: Stefano Accordini 2005 Ripassá  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)

description: This popular white wine from Tuscany is aged three months in oak for extra softness and creaminess. Aromas include honey, peach and slightly roasted almond. Pair this pretty wine with spicy Indian or Thai curries.
title: Teruzzi & Puthod 2006 Terre di Tufi White (Toscana)

description: Of the various Huber Pinot Noirs, this is the one most in need of 2–3 years of cellaring. Some pungent cabbage and cedar aromas should be better integrated by then, and the firm tannins now evident on the finish should also be at least partially resolved. Right now, there's a hint of silkiness and some nice plum and sous-bois notes that should only improve over the short term.
title: Huber 2005 Hecklinger Schlossberg R Trocken Spätburgunder (Baden)

description: Here's a big, rich, thick Pinot that almost seems more like a southern Rhône wine, it's that dark and full-bodied. The flavors are ripe and jammy, of pie-filling black cherries, black raspberries, cola, anise and smoky oak.
title: Keller Estate 2006 Precioso Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Here's a cheerful and beautifully aromatic blend of Pinot Grigio, Traminer and Riesling that boasts both freshness and complexity. The Pinot Grigio gives it weight and structure and the other two varieties create a fragrant bouquet of stone fruit and white flowers.
title: Lis Neris 2006 Confini White (Venezia Giulia)

description: Shows the classic structure of a fine Russian River Pinot, and Merry Edwards' way of making everything elegant. Dry and crisp, the wine displays cherry pulp and skin, cola, anise and spice flavors, wrapped into ultra-refined, velvety tannins. Doesn't seem to have the fruity focus and concentration of recent vintages, though, so drink soon.
title: Merry Edwards 2006 Olivet Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows the mushroomy, earthier side of New Zealand Pinot Noir, but does it very well, backing up those flavors with plenty of weight and intensity as well as cola-tinged dark fruit. Ends with some slightly coarse tannins, so put it away for a couple of years, or serve with a charred dry-aged steak.
title: Nanny Goat 2006 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Bring on the cheeseburgers! This is an outrageously delicious, easy-drinking Zin that will fall in love with charbroiled beef and melted cheese. It's not a terribly complicated wine, but perfect for immediate enjoyment with comfort foods.
title: Ottimino Vineyards 2005 Rancho Bello Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: A live-wire wine with baby powder, tropical fruit, citrus and green melon on the nose. Made in the forward, fruit-first style; it radiates with natural acidity such to the point that it's borderline aggressive. But with such power you also get strong green apple and grapefruit flavors. Edgy and citric overall, but at the same time you won't get shorted.
title: Cono Sur 2008 Visión Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is a modern, New World wine that boasts plush softness and a thick, velvety texture. Pair this wine with succulent beef, lamb or any meat that can stand up to its firm texture and solid tannins. Aromas include chocolate fudge, leather, allspice and clove.
title: Di Majo Norante 2005 Contado Aglianico (Molise)

description: Ramitello is a beautiful wine (85% Prugnolo and 15% Aglianico for power and structure) with soft, lush aromas of chocolate, espresso, leather, clove and dense blackberry fruit. The wine is yielding and generous and has absolutely no sharp edges.
title: Di Majo Norante 2005 Ramitello Red (Terra degli Osci)

description: Bang! One sniff of this wine and you are floating in those distinct, semisharp aromas that are Chilean Sauvignon Blanc. There's sea air, nettle and citrus galore, and then flavors of gooseberry, green fruit and grapefruit. It's fresh and forward, with angularity and strong varietal character.
title: Errazuriz 2008 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is a dark, huge Pinot Noir, so rich and opulently fruity that it might almost be a Grenache. It has a thick, soft mouthfeel, and is explosive in cherry jam, red licorice and mocha flavors that are utterly delicious. However, there's a certain direct appeal that lacks complexity and nuance. Drink now and over the next few years.
title: Etude 2006 Deer Camp Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A blend of 50% Merlot and 50% Cabernet, this delivers sassy aromas of leather and cinnamon, with ripe, pulpy fruit. There's a touch of cherry that gives the wine a soft, velvety finish.
title: Tenuta Vitalonga 2010 Elcione Red (Umbria)

description: The Albana varietal is usually made into dessert wine, but this interesting rendition is vinified dry. It opens with fragrant aromas of honey, peach and apricot. A touch of subtle sweetness marks the finish.
title: Tre Monti 2011 Vigna Rocca  (Albana di Romagna)

description: Crisp and green, this has a ripe, rounded apple flavor that lends the wine richness. There is a yeasty character to go with the fruitiness, while the refreshing acidity lasts through the finish.
title: Vera 2011 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A Cabernet Sauvignon-like version of Petit Verdot, this has tame tannins and is all around soft and mellow, with straightforward berry and cedar notes. It would make a fine food wine.
title: Yorkville Cellars 2009 Randle Hill Vineyard Petit Verdot (Yorkville Highlands)

description: A little on the slender side, but this is respectable for its dry, balanced texture and pleasant blackberry and black currant flavors. It shows real elegance, too, although it's not one for the cellar, so drink up.
title: Owl Ridge 2007 Brigden Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: This shows good blackberry and black currant flavors, with the smooth, rich tannins for which Oakville is noted. But there's no particular intensity or ageworthiness. Drink up.
title: Pine Ridge 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: This Sangiovese from central Italy offers abundant freshness and pretty aromas of wild berry, almond, cola and dried ginger. There's a touch of dried herb and licorice that gives the wine a bright, buoyant finish.
title: Rontana 2008 Sangiovese (Colli di Faenza)

description: Full of fig and grapefruit flavor, this was never aged in oak. A small addition of Sémillon adds to its richness and long finish.
title: Shooting Star 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: This is somewhat lean, but its elegantly tailored in its brisk acidity and dryness. While the cherry and berry flavors are modest, the wine's austerity makes it versatile with an enormous range of foods.
title: Stephen Ross 2010 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this pretty red delivers savory aromas of spice, cola and steak sauce, with cool, fruit intensity and bright acidity on the finish.
title: Tenuta Amalia 2010 Bio-571  (Sangiovese di Romagna)

description: A blend of Sangiovese, Montepulciano and Sagrantino, this is a rich, chewy red with savory aromas of cured meat and spice. There's a touch of ripe fruit and even a note on the finish that resembles cinnamon or ground nutmeg.
title: Roccafiore 2008 Prova d'Autore Red (Umbria)

description: Dark and savory, this has spicy aromas of clove, cinnamon, prune and red currant. It shows freshness and medium density overall.
title: Castelli del Grevepesa 2009 Clemente VII  (Chianti Classico)

description: Tasting sweet and hot, this sure is ripe. It has extracted flavors of jammy blackberry, cherry and cola. Drink now.
title: Chalk Hill 2009 Merlot-Malbec (Chalk Hill)

description: Eberle's Sangioveses are always dry, acidic and cherried. On their own, they're tight, rustic little monsters. Drink them with appropriate fare, and suddenly you're in Tuscany. Get out your Italian cookbook and find something with beef, fettucine, ragu and plenty of cheese.
designation: Hidden Valley Vineyard 51%, Wine Bush Vineyard 36%, Filipponi & Thompson Vineyard 13%
title: Eberle 2009 Hidden Valley Vineyard 51%, Wine Bush Vineyard 36%, Filipponi & Thompson Vineyard 13% Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

description: Composed of Sangiovese, Sagrantino, Merlot and Montepulciano, this offers pretty tones of spice and wild berry, with background tones of tobacco and worn leather.
title: Fongoli 2009  Montefalco Rosso

description: Earthy notes of clay and mushroom lend a rugged complexity to aromas of roasted plums and cherries on this lush yet composed wine. The palate is densely concentrated with black cherry flavor, but anchored with bright acidity and a blanket of velvet tannins.
title: Shalestone 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: Touches of vanilla, toast and sweet biscuit waft sumptuously from this classically-styled Chardonnay-Pinot Noir sparkler. Delicate and supple in mousse, it finishes vivaciously and fresh with a streak of lemon-lime acidity.
title: Sparkling Pointe 2010 Brut  (North Fork of Long Island)
